The phase 3 trials of the Moderna: Novavax, Pfizer/BioNTech, and Johnson & Johnson vaccines involved a large number of volunteers and followed them over time to assess the effectiveness of the vaccines.
The misconception that vaccines don: t prevent infection but rather reduce symptoms is debunked, as vaccines are designed to train the immune system to recognize and fight specific pathogens.
Vaccines: including seasonal influenza, rotavirus, whooping cough, and pneumococcal vaccines, aim to prevent severe illness, hospitalization, and death, even if they may not completely stop infection.
